      39             : 
      40             : /**
      41             :  * A single keyframe.
      42             :  *
      43             :  * This is the canonical form in which keyframe effects are stored and
      44             :  * corresponds closely to the type of objects returned via the getKeyframes()
      45             :  * API.
      46             :  *
      47             :  * Before computing an output animation value, however, we flatten these frames
      48             :  * down to a series of per-property value arrays where we also resolve any
      49             :  * overlapping shorthands/longhands, convert specified CSS values to computed
      50             :  * values, etc.
      51             :  *
      52             :  * When the target element or style context changes, however, we rebuild these
      53             :  * per-property arrays from the original list of keyframes objects. As a result,
      54             :  * these objects represent the master definition of the effect's values.
      55             :  */
